attributes.action: Reduce the price of British citizenship for children from £973 to less than £600
attributes.background: The price for British citizenship for children is currently £973, and without this they can't vote or claim student loans. The Home Office makes over £500 profit for each application and this makes many families unable to afford citizenship. The government are putting a price on democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
These children will, later in life, pay taxes as a normal citizen would, but will not benefit in the same way.

As well as this, over 3,000 children that do apply, are denied the citizenship and not refunded the £973 fee.

The right to these has been given to these children by parliament, but currently they are being sold by the home office.

To find out more about the issue, you can read this article:

https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/534zx8/the-british-born-kids-who-cant-afford-to-be-british

attributes.action: Make the use of Smoke Bombs legal in UK Football Grounds to improve atmosphere
attributes.background: Whilst the use of smoke bombs in football grounds tend to be legal in many parts of Europe they are not in the UK. Making the use of smoke bombs in football grounds in the Uk will vastly help to improve the atmosphere of games and attendances will see a rise as a result.
attributes.additional_details: Although it is understood that smoke bombs are seen as pyrotechnics they are much less dangerous than the use of flares and fireworks which may cause a fire. On the other hand smoke bombs have very rarely caused a fire. If this was to become legal there should only be a specific place as to where the smoke grenades can be set off, this should be in the most open area of the ground should then be sign posted to make other supporters aware, if they do not wish to come into contact with the smoke.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and give the money to the NHS
attributes.background: NHS short of funds, people can allow as they do now the time required for a journey, saving 25 minutes is secondary to saving lives.

attributes.action: Stop all shipments of nuclear waste to Australia immediately.
attributes.background: The UK contaminated and destroyed Aboriginal lands with nuclear bomb tests in 1950s and1960s. We must apologise for that and never repeat such crimes against nature and humanity. This Government now proposes to ship UK nuclear waste to Australia and dump it there: this must be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: Sending nuclear waste faraway is not a solution; burying it out of sight is not sensible either.  The Government seem to be arguing that they are entitled to send UK waste to Australia and after that they cannot be blamed if it ends up in Aboriginal Lands. Apart from the fact that sending such waste to the other side of the world is primitively irresponsible, it is cynical and further abuse of Aboriginal people. British people should forbid  our Government to do any such thing.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for discrimination of those with non-offensive visible tattoos.
attributes.background: Times are changing, and we as a country have to change with them.  Many workplaces can and will choose to discriminate against those who have visible tattoos.  Non-discrimination is a cross-cutting principle in international human rights law.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 1 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights: “All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights".

Article 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights: "The right to communicate and express yourself in any medium, including words, pictures and actions".

Two of our Basic human rights that employers violate. Discrimination against Race, Gender, Age, Sexual Orientation & Disabilities have all been addressed, now we should address the discrimination of visible body art.

attributes.action: Review the current VED (Road tax) system and implement a pay per mile system.
attributes.background: The current road tax system uses a blanket rule type system to cover the taxation of all uk vehicles based solely on emissions. This system does not take into account how much time each of these vehicles is spent on the road causing wear and tear on the road network.
attributes.additional_details:
A review and overhaul of the tax system is required to bring a  fairer balance to road users. 

E.g - a pensioner who makes one trip a week in his car.  Should not pay the same amount in road tax as someone who uses their car for commuting to work everyday.

The current system does not reflect road use/wear and tear on the network. This could be easily be rectified by directly linking the VED (Road tax) to the fuel at the pump. 

The more fuel you use in your car the more tax you pay.

attributes.action: Make it a Law for ALL Councils to log/record any Deceased/Injured cats !
attributes.background: When my cat went missing 24th Nov 17, I was told by the council that they do NOT log cats found, I want a system to be made compulsory, whereby a record is kept of cats found deceased or injured. I was informed that most are thrown into garbage vehicles and treated as rubbish. THIS HAS TO STOP !
attributes.additional_details: Most owners call their local council asking if their beloved furbaby has been picked up by street cleaners/bin men etc. My local council advised me that while a few caring street cleaners will kindly take a cat to the nearest vet, most do not and heartlessly dispose of them without a thought, leaving devastated owners needlessly searching for their family pet. With the huge news at present about cruelty/mutilation towards cats, its imperative to record these pets for possible investigations.

attributes.action: Make getting a tattoo legal at 16 legal with parental consent.
attributes.background: Waiting to be 18 to get a tattoo can be a long, hard wait but sometimes, not everyone can reach it. It's devastating. If getting a tattoo at 16 becomes legal with the parent's consent then people can get something symbolic before they go. This, I hope is something that many others will agree on.

attributes.action: Make all job centres have toilets.
attributes.background: jobcentres are places that thousands of people use, all jobcentres therefore should have toilets.  This is important particularly because many people who use the jobcentre may have health conditions that mean they need to get to a toilet as fast as possible.

attributes.action: Hold a debate in the Commons about the American gun control system
attributes.background: After the Vegas massacre, The Pulse night club shooting, San Bernardino, and a shooting yesterday in Fort Collins and countless other shootings, a debate is needed in the Commons about Gun control in the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017 in the US, 12,300 deaths have been caused by guns. 3,000 deaths are people who were under 18. There's been 286 mass shootings in the US. These figures don't include 22,000 annual suicides which use guns. If the UK had a similar population to the USA 1,000 UK citizens would die annually in comparison. 
http://www.gunviolencearchive.org/  
https://www.justfacts.com/guncontrol.asp  
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/06/16/gun-violence-united-kingdom-united-states/85994716/

attributes.action: Introduce a visa esta or esa system (like Canada/USA) for non-eu visitors to UK
attributes.background: Currently, USA, Canada and Australia require foreign visitors (including British people) to complete a visa entry application prior to travel. Anybody with a historical criminal record must apply for a police certificate and await clearance from those countries, before being allowed entry.
attributes.additional_details: Britons are being refused entry to Canada and Australia particularly, for historic criminal records - even childhood cautions and less serious records -such as drink driving twenty years ago. A similar system should exist in the UK to vet potential visitors from non-eu countries.

attributes.action: Return Welsh devolved powers to UK Government and Parliament
attributes.background: 20yrs of Devolved Powers have not delivered real benefit to the people of Wales and many people are disillusioned by the Assembly and failing public services.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/education/education-expert-lays-out-criticisms-12170188

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/apr/10/welsh-nhs-waiting-times-uk-tests-patients-wales

attributes.action: Abolish the TV licence
attributes.background: The TV licence fee is supporting the BBC which offers a biased opinion on all matters relating to the British public.

attributes.action: Scrap tuition fees for paramedic science and nursing degrees
attributes.background:
Tuition fees for students studying in England are £9250 a year regardless of the course being studied and the expected salary.
This means that students studying degrees such as nursing or paramedic science who will largely go into the NHS where salaries are capped are having to incur huge debts
attributes.additional_details:
Tuition fees were supposed to be a way of ensuring students who went on to earn higher salaries by virtue of their degree paid by the tax payer. Yet this now includes nurses and paramedics who have to have a degree rather than learning the skills on the job with time out for classroom based learning. 
They also have their salaries capped by the government and at the same time there are a shortage of nurses and paramedics who are essential to the smooth running of the NHS.

attributes.action: Open up the Help to Buy ISA scheme to those who have previously owned property
attributes.background: Currently if you have previously owned a property you are not eligible for the Help to Buy ISA scheme whereby the government will boost your savings by 25%. This means that people who have lost their homes (often single parent families) are not offered the same support as first time buyers.

attributes.action: Deduct any money payable under the Brexit agreement from the Foreign Aid Budget.
attributes.background: There is public opposition to our bloated foreign aid budget and also to any Brexit payment. It makes sense to mitigate the burden on taxpayers by subsidising Brexit from the Foreign Aid Budget.

attributes.action: Urgently stop student loan sales which are happening now.
attributes.background: Despite the student loans crisis, on 31st October 2017, Jo Johnson MP said he was going ahead with the sale of student loans. If the loan sales go ahead, students' interest and loan payments will end up in the pockets of private investors. This marketisation of education needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: Even though there are three unfinished government inquiries into student loans at the moment, Jo Johnson announced he was proceeding with the sale of student loans. Loan sales should be stopped until the inquiries are completed. Loan sales crystallize loan terms so it is difficult for students to benefit from improvements made to loan terms. Loan sales also expose the taxpayer and student borrowers to risk of footing the bill for warranties and indemnities for sale arrangers and investors.

attributes.action: Form a dedicated recovery/response unit on the QE2 bridge/dartford crossing/A282
attributes.background: Every day users of the QE2 bridge/ Dartford crossing have to endure horrendous queues as a result of stranded vehicles blocking the carriageway through breakdown or accident . Let's have a dedicated response team to get the lanes open asap
attributes.additional_details: With revenue of 160 million pounds last year surely a response team can be budgeted in to quickly remove stranded vehicles on the run up stretches north and south of the crossing as well as the A282 and move them to a safe place instead of waiting hours for recovery from the drivers own breakdown service or insurer. The loss to the economy must run into millions of pounds a year and creates havoc and misery for users and drivers in the surrounding areas

attributes.action: Stop the planned upgrade of the M6 between J2-4 until other works are complete.
attributes.background: It's has been announced that works are to begin on upgrading the M6 between J2-4 to "smart motorway". There are works ongoing between J1-2 on the M5 as well as M6 junction 16-19. These should be completed first.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times through the Midlands are already frustrating enough as it is with the amount of road work projects on going. The highways agency should not be allowed to begin another project in the region until they have completed the ones they have ongoing at the moment.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down. Drivers should be required to retake their test every 5 years after they turn 65.

attributes.action: Exempt those giving evidence of Sexual Abuse from the Official Secrets Act.
attributes.background: When investigating cases of historical sexual abuse against children and young people many prominent accused were in positions of power and protected by Civil Servants and Military Personnel. These people were by the very nature of their job, subject to the Official Secrets Act.
attributes.additional_details:
If a true and factual finding of an individuals guilt or innocence is to be found it is essential that ALL evidence available should be disclosed, without fear of prosecution, to the investigating body by ANY person having relevant information.

This petition therefore calls upon HM Government to specifically exempt, by legislation, any person providing information to a statutory investigating body in relation to Sexual Abuse cases, irrespective of any act of Parliament they may be subject to.

attributes.action: Schools to teach anti crime and anti gang culture within schools.
attributes.background: With the constant rise in gang related death and crime it’s time to make a difference. Schools should teach anti crime and anti gang culture as early as junior school. We all need to work together to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
No parent wants to hear their child is the victim of crime bullying or hate, but worse still no one wants that knock at the door to say their child has died as a victim of it! 
Stop it before it starts we need to stamp out the whole gang culture that is rapidly growing within our schools and streets.
Children become involved due to peer pressure and it becomes a case of be a bully or be a victim! It has to stop.
Schools to clamp down and teach strict anti gang bullying and crime in schools.

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Tampon Tax' once the UK has left the European Union.
attributes.background: The 'Tampon Tax' is currently at the lowest rate possible under EU's VAT rules. Once the UK has left the EU, there is an opportunity for the Government to abolish the 'Tampon Tax', therefore taking a step towards eradicating period poverty.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Plan International UK found that 1 in 10 girls or women aged 14 to 21 in Britain cannot afford sanitary towels or tampons.
Period Poverty is a massive issue in the UK, and abolishing the 'Tampon Tax' would help to reduce the number of women and girls affected by it. Girls should not be missing school or using unsanitary items such as socks, tissue or newspaper, to avoid bleeding through their clothes.

attributes.action: Negotiate right for EU/UK citizens to hold a second EU passport after 2019
attributes.background: Many people who are British born EU citizens, believe they are having their citizenship summarily removed against their will.  This resentment could be easily avoided by negotiating the right for UK Citizens to hold a second EU passport after Brexit.  This would help heal the rift in the UK.

attributes.action: NHS to stop supplying paracetamol on prescriptions and hospital discharges
attributes.background: I believe that paracetamol, ibuprofen and other over the counter items shouldn’t be supplied at a cost to the NHS when they can be bought for as little as 16p from Tesco and other retail stores. I believe the UK public should realise how much this costs the NHS

attributes.action: Don't put down Army dogs because they can't be re-homed. We owe a duty of care
attributes.background:
Two hero Army dogs which helped save thousands of lives on duty in Afghanistan are to be put down because they can't be re-homed, it has been reported.
Ex soldiers and dog handlers who worked with the Belgian Shepherds are said to have written to a Defence chief demanding the decision be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
“This is such a cruel way to treat these animals that have given us so much.
“People who worked closely with these dogs are devastated at the plans — they’ve begged to save them all.
"Experienced handlers have come forward to say they want to house the much-loved dogs, who have helped save hundreds of lives. 
In 2012, The Mirror reported how 807 of our much-loved military dogs had been destroyed by the Army over the past decade despite years of faithful service.
Daily Mirror online 1/12.17

attributes.action: To make Remembrance Sunday a national holiday for all ex service men/woman.
attributes.background: My husband was in the Army for 13 years, he was in The Kings Royals Hussars. During his time he served in the Gulf, Northern Ireland and Kosovo. Over the past few years, because of shift patterns, his work day has fallen on remembrance Sunday and he has been unable to parade with his comrades.

attributes.action: Begin talks to expel Russia from the UN security council
attributes.background: In light of the poisoning of Sergei Skripal with a chemical agent (the first time in Europe since WW2), the poisoning of Alexander Litvinenko, the use of chemical weapons in Syria and the annexation of Crimea, Russia should be expelled from the UN Security Council.

attributes.action: We want Government funded support for teachers with mental health issues
attributes.background: We strongly believe that there should be more government funded support systems put in place for teachers who suffer from mental health illnesses. Also for teachers who feel like they are under too much pressure from crippling workload and could benefit from support to help deal with this.
attributes.additional_details: From research, we have discovered that the majority of mental health support systems were for young adults that stop aged 18. Granted, NHS adult mental health support does exist, however the time patients must wait for this service is incredibly long. This then creates an ongoing issue for people who are still suffering after the age of 18, and are being placed on the never ending waiting list of adult mental health services.

attributes.action: We demand that the Govt. takes immediate action to solve the NHS crisis.
attributes.background:
1. Re-introduce SEN nurses to fill current vacancies
2. Re-introduce a bursary for nurses qualifying via university degree
3. Grant VISAs for Drs and GPs waiting to come to UK
4. Reverse the 'new' contracts forced on hospital doctors
5. Confirm that no further PFIs or PF2s will be agreed
attributes.additional_details:
1. SEN nurses can learn and work at same time and have higher retention rate.
2. Nurses are discouraged by huge cost of university fees
3. There are suitably qualified doctors waiting to join NHS but prevented by no VISA
4. Doctors are working under unfair conditions and should not be forced to work 7 days a week.
5. The burden of PFIs and PF2s are unfairly placed on individual trusts. The Govt. should take out capital loans as they are cheaper in long term. Existing ones should be bought out.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wild caught species in the pet trade
attributes.background: Reptiles and fish are the most affected. 100s species of fish have gone extinct over the last 100 years because of the pet trade as they have been taken from their homes. It’s the same with reptiles, invertebrates and mammals.
attributes.additional_details: Imagine being a tortoise living in the desert and one day someone comes, puts you in a cage, ships you off to somewhere you don’t know and before you know it you are behind glass, ready to be sold to people -  many of whom don’t treat their pets right . Many animals die in the transportation from their homes to the pet shop . Fish are caught using cyanide, divers spray it on the coral reef to paralyse the fish then catch them and take them to be exported worldwide. This is wrong it needs to end.

attributes.action: Require manufacturers of milk alternatives to use non-plastic bottles.
attributes.background: I care deeply about the environment and I hate seeing the continual use of non-recyclable plastic cartons for my dairy-free alternatives to milk. I do not see why they cannot be manufactured into  environmentally friendly containers. I wish this environmental issue to be discussed in parliament.

attributes.action: Create a January re-sit opportunity for all GCSE English and maths re-sits.
attributes.background: More students than ever in FE colleges are finding themselves back in contexts associated with failure. For many, the November re-sit is too early. January, on the other hand, would allow sufficient time for effective preparation and for teachers to assess who is and isn't ready.

attributes.action: Stop pharmacies from being able to withhold medicines on the grounds of beliefs
attributes.background: I’ve recently heard several women’s experiences of being withheld contraceptive medicines like the morning after pill because of pharmacists' personal beliefs.
attributes.additional_details: Through these experiences, many women are going home and worrying about possible pregnancy. In the health and social care industry, care and treatment cannot be withheld due to the personal beliefs of staff as it would be a violation of human rights. It shouldn’t be okay for pharmacists to withhold medicines from women on this basis - providing medicine and treatment for contraceptive purposes is a large role of a Pharmacist and failing to provide these is a failure in a first world country.

attributes.action: Give PCV Cat D drivers Cat C (HGV) entitlement
attributes.background:
Currently there is a shortage of Cat C HGV drivers if Cat D entitled drivers were given Cat C status this would help close the shortfall. 
Cat D & C test are almost the same and the vehicles have the same characteristics in movement.

attributes.action: Stop the funding cuts to the police service in Redbridge and adjoining boroughs
attributes.background: There have been a spike in the number of burglaries in Redbridge borough which has caused great concern and fear to the residents within the area. Lack of funding has caused these crimes to go uninvestigated leading to greater frustration in the area.

attributes.action: Abolish minimum income floor for the self employed zero contracts and disabled.
attributes.background: The requirement of MIF removes flexibility for the disabled, zero hours contracts and self employed workers, which by nature can be seasonal and erratic.It undermines the contribution that disabled and self employed people make and throttles entrepreneurs who could ultimately go on to employ others.
attributes.additional_details:
An employee earning £12000 a year from employment is topped up with approx £500 of extra support in a month. If a self-employed worker earning £12,000 a year earns an extra £200 in a given month it would reduce their entitlement by £90, while taking home £200 less in another month would increase their entitlement by just £5.How is this fair?

Source: Resolution Foundation

attributes.action: Block UK Government from using tax payer funds to bail out Carillion plc
attributes.background: Carillion plc is the main contractor to HS2, among other major projects and have been in financial difficulty for over a year.  It is likely that the UK taxpayer will be expected to fund a bailout of Carillion to enable HS2 to continue to plan.  The UK taxpayer should not need to rescue a plc
attributes.additional_details: (From the Guardian) For over a year now, Carillion has been in meltdown. Its shares have dropped 90%, it’s issued profit warnings, and it’s on to its third chief executive within six months. And this week, the government moved into emergency mode. A group of ministers held a crisis meeting on Thursday to discuss the firm. Around the table, reports the FT, were business secretary Greg Clark, as well as ministers from the Cabinet Office, health, transport, justice, education and local government

attributes.action: Abolish "Safe Country Reviews Policy" against Refugee and HP granted people.
attributes.background:
Refugees will now take part in a Safe Return Review five years after their refugee status is granted

The review will decide if refugees are able to stay in the UK or will return to their home

Under the policy, all those who apply for settlement will be subject to a called "Safe Return Review"
attributes.additional_details:
Campaigners claim the measures would put an end to hope of stability and end any possibility of refugees being able to integrate into society

Organisations that have signed the letter include Black Lives Matter UK, the Northern Ireland Community of Refugees and Asylum Seekers, the Scottish Refugee Council, Migrant Voice, Space4U Cardiff, Manchester Migrant Solidarity. ETC

There are now facing an uncertain five years

These are troubling times, The very idea of human rights is under threat

attributes.action: Push for a two-state solution with Jerusalem the capital of Palestine
attributes.background: Trump is expected to acknowledge Jerusalem being the capital of Israel and move the US embassy there. This will put the Middle-East peace process at risk along with the rights of Christians and Muslims.
attributes.additional_details: The UK must use its global influence to continue to push for a two state solution with the 1947 borders.

attributes.action: Tell us what level of patient care is planned in the NHS for June 2018
attributes.background:
Following the small increased funding for the NHS in the November 2017 budget what will be the following measures of the care it plans compared to this year:
•	expected waiting times 
•	areas and the quantification of care rationing that will take place 
•	estimated numbers of bed-blockers
attributes.additional_details: The information that is available concerning problems in the NHS is sufficient to cause worry that health and social care will deteriorate. We need to understand what level of care is planned by the Government so that we can make a case for a revision in the funding if necessary.

attributes.action: Save Old Heath Saxon Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire.
attributes.background: Old Heath Saxon Church mentioned in the Doomsday Book is going to be demolished for HS2 ROUTE. Save our Saxon history, we wouldn't knock down Stonehenge or other historic structures. Please don't let this happen.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 proposed route

attributes.action: Nationalise the national lottery run by Camelot.
attributes.background:
All profits should go to NHS and schools etc.
It is a licence to print money so why  should a foreign company profit from a state run franchise.
attributes.additional_details: why shouldn't all profits go to bus or schools.

attributes.action: Make all public body shaming in the media, and in public, a criminal offence.
attributes.background: 94% of teenagers girls have faced being body shamed - this causes teenagers to be body dimorphic, depressed, anorexic and in severe cases, can lead them to have suicidal thoughts. It is a very serious problem, especially in the era of social media and nothing is being done about it.
attributes.additional_details:
Body-shaming:
>The action or practice of humiliating someone by making mocking or critical comments about their body shape or size.

Body dimorphic disorder (BDD) is a mental disorder characterized by the obsessive idea that some aspect of one's own appearance is severely flawed and warrants exceptional measures to hide or fix it.

attributes.action: Introduce consequences of prolonged pornography use into sex education
attributes.background: Symptoms of porn addiction include intense feelings of depression, shame and isolation, a disintegration of relationships with family and friends, loss of interest in non-porn activities such as school, socialising, exercise and trouble in school. Children must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Mary Anne Layden, called porn the ‘most concerning thing to psychological health that I know of existing today.’ “The internet is a perfect drug delivery system because you are anonymous, aroused and have role models for these behaviours,”. “To have drugs pumped into your house 24/7, free, and children know how to use it better than grown-ups — it’s a perfect delivery system if we want to have a whole generation of young addicts who will never have the drug out of their minds,” she added.

"If we, as a society, shy away from talking about this issue, we are failing the thousands of young people it is affecting" Peter Liver.

The younger the user, the greater the neural response to porn, potentially for the long-term (Cambridge University Study).

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell air gun pellets if they’re not traceable
attributes.background: My 10 month old kitten was shot at in the eye purposefully in daylight hours by an air rifle owner. Causing huge damage, pain and potential eyesight loss for my kitten.Though this is illegal, there are no serial numbers to trace back who is buying pellets, making prosecution difficult/impossible.
attributes.additional_details: The pain and hurt caused not only to our kitten but us as owners is immense. Not to mention the increasing vet bills and taking time off work. However the criminal walks away without any repercussion and that needs to change.

attributes.action: Increase the age that a puppy can be imported into the UK to six months.
attributes.background:
By doing so the risk to the individuals dog's health and behaviour, the risk to healthy dogs within this country will reduced hugely.  
This will tackle the illegal puppy trade as dogs will be more mature when imported and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Importing a puppy can cause great harm to the dog through the impacts it will have on its behaviour and health. This also put other dogs at risk as the puppy can be carrying diseases such as rabies and lung worm which are not found natively in the UK. 
By raising the legal age of importing it reduces these risks along with tackling the illegal puppy trade. At six months old dogs are more mature and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.

attributes.action: Consider legislation that guarantees every community has access to at a free ATM
attributes.background: It is a myth that an advanced society must necessarily be cashless. In Germany, a country which knows the perils of authoritarianism, more than 80% of transactions are in cash, as citizens safeguard their privacy and freedom. Even in the US, 45% of transactions are in cash.
attributes.additional_details:
Cash machines ‘to disappear within a decade’, ATM boss warns

Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2017/12/03/cash-machines-to-disappear-within-a-decade-atm-boss-warns-7129080/?ito=cbshare
Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroUK | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MetroUK

The push for a cashless society is all about greed

Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5045305/The-cynical-conspiracy-stop-using-cash.html#ixzz50LGqAJJD

attributes.action: Audit every MP and Lord to check on the Cyber Security of their office
attributes.background: In the light of claims made by some MPs on twitter that they have shared their computer password with their office team we believe there is a major cyber security risk throughout the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.additional_details: We understand that the rules set out for employees in Westminster make it clear that passwords should not be disclosed to other people. However the tweets referred to above indicate that at least 2 MPs have failed to follow these rules.

attributes.action: Community Alarm Services should be permitted to use bus lanes without penalty.
attributes.background: We are firmly of the belief that Community Alarm Services are a vital emergency service in the community for vulnerable people. The service providers should be able to use bus lanes to speed up their travel time to their service users to reduce or prevent further injury and distress.
